title: Can we please stop resourceless mobility creep?

replies.body:
I think Renekton is one of the few with a somewhat meaningful CD on his dash.
(starts at 18 seconds and goes down to 14 seconds, even with CDR it is fairly unlikely to use it again in a fight and as you said they are short range)

Although Gnar isn't particularly mobile either, his dash is a bit better than Renekton's in terms of range, but the CC (and likely damage) followup after he dashes to you is much more brutal.
(It's 18sec first rank and goes down to 12sec)

Mini gnar gets extra movespeed from his passive, movespeed from his w, a slow to kite you around with, and is ranged. That's why he's so broken in lane. Being ranged makes his mobility more abusive because you're forced to burn your gapcloser to get to him after which he can dash away and kite you stupid hard.

Oh yeah. I forgot about his MS on W.

Yes I know ranged makes mobility 500x worse to face if they know how to kite. Kalista shows that.

Gnar's moblity isn't over the top mobility wise, but being able to bounce away as a squishy harrasser who has a slow, or to be able to gapclose as a mega CC tank, it doesn't make sense balance wise IMO.  But he's a new champ and all of their kits have to be overloaded in order to be played
Good to know that someone downvoted every comment on this thread. Go resourceless mobility!
Rengar has a *HUGE* cost to his mobility. He's not even close to being Lee Sin, Zed, Riven, Kalista or Yasuo. Akali can only go in, she can't escape, again not even close to being as bad as those.

There are costs for most of those champions.
Akali & Yasuo requires enemy units to dash to.
Gnar, Katarina, Rengar are in it to win it. While Katarina can get reset to get out, those units are generally stuck where they land most of the time, so if they bite off more than they can chew they will die for it.
Kalista is an abomination, this is known and we'll leave it at that.
Rek'sai only has great mobility situationally with pre existing tunnels, so it requires her to have previously spent some time in the area and the enemy team to not destroy said tunnel. After her number nerfs, I think Rek'sai is not a problematic champions anymore.
Lee Sin is Lee Sin.
Renekton again has limits on his mobility, he only gets one small dash if he doesn't hit a unit (Ie running away from ganks).
I love your logic. "Akali and Yasuo need enemy units" "Kalista is an abomination". Last time i checked Kalista needed enemy units too.

Kalista has an untargeted jump if there's an enemy in 550 range or on her Q CD. Akali and Yasou can only go in one direction.

I'm not sure how much better it is, but it is better.

When you are chasing, Akali and Yasuos mobility is way better, they don't spend 3 item slots to get it, and it's still almost instant (though Yasuo requires minions to chase, but so does Kalista). When you are escaping, Akali can use W over a wall and then just dash to a jungle camp (it gives vision). Whenever Yasuos mobility is better for escaping simply depends if there are nearby minions or not, otherwise Kalista is better.

>When you are escaping, Akali can use W over a wall and then just dash to a jungle camp (it gives vision).

I'm going to point out that Kalista can do the same thing without vision or the risk of the camp being down since her Q lets her jump. Also this is harder to do with the ult range nerfs.

It's actually really hard to jump over walls as Kalista (except those really thin ones like the Krugs), It always takes me multiple attempts, at which point i'm probably dead anyway. Maybe if you have tier 3 boots, but that's really late game.

Also how is it harder to use Akali R on a jungle camp becuase of R range nerfs? You always get into like 500 range to put the shroud onto the camp anyway, so the fact that the range went from 800 to 700 means nothing

>Also how is it harder to use Akali R on a jungle camp becuase of R range nerfs?

Things like jumping the wall to wolves towards the center of the map and dragon jumps (which were hard as hell to do before) aren't possible anymore.

>It's actually really hard to jump over walls as Kalista

Jumps with Q work in reverse, you jump further forward.
not sure wether to ask if ur retarded or plain havent seen kalista

I'm fine with mobility being on champions and being in this game. Its a slightly healthy mechanic on its own, but what is bad is there is TO MUCH OF IT. There are the huge offenders as mentioned above who have 0 trade off for it, But there are some champions also in this game that just make you think "Do they really need that dash at all?"

This is Ghostcrawler's stance about mobility creep made in another [thread](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/2TavB1Ax-dear-riot-can-we-get-a-straight-no-nonsense-description-of-what-your-vision-for-this-game-is?comment=0016):
> Mobility is fun and useful or we wouldnt't keep adding it to kits. The problem is that too often it comes for free just to give a champ a little extra pizzazz. Roles that need a lot of mobility, like assassins, aren't a huge problem, but roles that already bring a lot to the table, especially mages and ADCs, can be. Even with these it doesn't need to be an ironclad rule that they can't dash, but they do need to pay for it elsewhere in their power budget. For these champs, we are less likely to nerf their movement mechanic and more likely to reduce their damage, survivability or control to pay for the mechanic.

Yeah, that post was pretty eye-opening for me.

I'm slowly realizing League isn't the game for me anymore. I get frustrated more and more every game in the last year and often because of stuff like this.

I really don't think it makes much sense to include {{champion:84}} , {{champion:64}} , {{champion:58}} and {{champion:92}} on this list since they're super old champs who've never been reworked.

Sure they have resourceless mobility but they're far to old to be contributing to any sort of creep, Akali came out just after the game left closed beta.

Aside from Renekton, all of them are actually really big offenders. Akali has 3 targeted gap closers that also reset on kill. Lee Sin has 2 gapclosers just in case he fucks up getting into your backline and kicking your ADC into his team, and if he is so bad he can just flash as a fail safe. Riven is.... well Riven. You can't tell me 4 spammable dashes are not a problem.

The OP was specifically talking about a creep, or the tendency for more recent champs to gain something older champs didn't have. I don't think that a champ who was released in 2010 with no kit reworks should be considered at all relevant to creeps in 2015. (unless they're the ones getting creeped)

All four of the champs I mentioned were released in 2010/2011 and have received no major kit reworks.
Wait... so if the older champions are also super mobile, doesn't that mean there's no creep at all?

>Wait... so if the older champions are also super mobile, doesn't that mean there's no creep at all?

No, There is an increase of super mobile champs recently.

The last 5 champs were Rek'sai, Kalista, Azir, Gnar and Braum, all of whom have dashes. Out of the last 15 champions only 2 of them don't have a dash or blink (Jinx, Vel'kos) and 5 of them have super low CD dashes or multiple dashes. (Rek'sai, Kalista, Yasuo, Lucian, Vi)

There certainly is a mobility creep, it's just that champs from 2010/11 aren't the ones causing it.

> [{quoted}](name=Hurny Quilva,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=zn4T1HVZ,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2015-02-24T09:34:12.129+0000)

> Aside from Renekton, all of them are actually really big offenders. Akali has 3 targeted gap closers that also reset on kill. You can't tell me 4 spammable dashes are not a problem.

Back before the mobility creep, that was Akali's defining trait. The ability to stick to a target like no one else could. That was her identity. Are you trying to say that there should be NO highly mobile champs in the league at all? Laughable.

Yes, it's a problem that now every other champ has just as much mobility (and more versatile mobility, too), but that really doesn't have anything to do with Akali.
Rengar and renekton aren't on the Same boat. Rengar isn't an high mobility creep because ,as akali, he is an all in champ

Akali? Sure, she can dash a lot, but that's mobility tied to her ultimate. And she's simply old design.
Gnar being highly mobile and able to kite like a Kalista is stupid indeed.
Lee Sin could use not being able to wardjump I guess.
Katarina is a close range AoE caster. With 0 utility. And has to be built AP. Let that sink in for a moment.
Kalista - I totally agree.
Rek'Sai - dude. Her mobility is gated by huge cooldowns and if you manage to let her have a tunnel network, you deserve the hell you get. Super telegraphed.
Renekton - how is he even mobility creep. I don't even.
Rengar - this guy actually happens to use an ult to get to you most of the time, and his mobility is high risk and high reward. Well...
Riven - she was outraging with her mobility, but right now it's not even that much of a problem.
Yasuo - sure, but keep in mind his mobility is conditional. 
Zed - he is on par with Riven's mobility bar his ult return, and even then, he has the lowest burst of all mobile assassins.

I get that manaless mobility is a problem, but most of these champs actually DO pay for it somehow - you just refuse to acknowledge it.

More importantly, why is  {{champion:76}} not on your list?

You need to take RESOURCELESS into account like it is on the title.


You act like Katarina is horrible and isnt a hyper carry with insanely stupid roam potential. But oh no she has no CC and is melee!

Reksai is massively mobile with her ult to go from spawn to any tunnel. Her burrow gives her extra movement speed and a tunnel network can take you from camp to camp. If you save her tunnel for a massive gap closer and knock up you can easily kill people with ease. the point of reksai is to go in and explode. She is stupidly mobile.

Renekton can get to your backline with ease with a double dash, he is tanky and does absurd damage if fed. Doesnt always happen but he isnt a bad champion. Focus on his strengths when ahead and youll realize why hes there.

Already explained rengar twice.

Yasuo has unlimited dashes pretty much if there are minions, but also a gap closer ult that gets him right on top of you. Which can be easily used if your team has knock ups. Hence why hes played with a knock up comp.. Dont even mention his low cooldown Q, double crits or armor pen.

And I just did put Nidalee on the list. I forgot, she is horribly busted right now.  Manaless jumps every 1.75 seconds and insane excecute. Yeah...

> [{quoted}](name=Korthalia,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=zn4T1HVZ,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-02-24T07:52:04.710+0000)
>

> Katarina is a close range AoE caster. **With 0 utility.** And has to be built AP. Let that sink in for a moment.

Not exactly... Katarina does have some forms of utility, but they're really bad unless she's being chased by someone within melee ranged that doesn't have a targeted or a long range gap close (namely her w). Her shunpo's damage reduction is also mediocre at best (15% for less than 2 seconds at all ranks), and her Death Lotus' grievous wounds is okay due to the fact it's AOE.

> [{quoted}](name=Korthalia,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=zn4T1HVZ,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-02-24T07:52:04.710+0000)

This is what I figured, as well. His first W is practically the same thing as Braum's, who can only hop to allied champions or minions (and possibly pets? I forget), or they could use it selfishly for the sustain...Yet Lee is allowed to use his safety jump selfishly for sustain AND added mobility.

If they can justify disallowing Braum from ward jumping with an ability designed to protect his allies, surely the same reasoning can be applied to Lee Sin's ally-protecting ability as well.

Disagree. Champions being able to engage and disengage makes the game a lot more interesting/engaging both inside the laning phase and out. It's quite boring when two champions have no choice but to slap each other in melee range until someone walks away or dies. Laning against the champions you listed is usually pretty enjoyable. I personally find Gnar to be the most annoying champion in the entire game to lane against, but I also enjoy the challenge and satisfaction of beating a good one.
So you want to just delete anyone with low mobility/engage potential because they dont have free gap closers. Which makes your laning phase boring. Got it

> So you want to just delete anyone with low mobility/engage potential because they dont have free gap closers.

Yup, that's why Rumble and Lissandra were never picked in LCS, compared to the pick/ban Riven and Akali.

Theres a difference between being a good team fighter and being insanely mobile. Liss is decently mobile but she cant become a 1v5 god like some of the champions above can. There is a cost to her mobility. Mana, high cool down, slow travel time.

I said nothing in relation to team fighting or 1v5 or cost to mobility.

> So you want to just delete anyone with low mobility/engage potential because they dont have free gap closers.

I simply agreed with your statement that Rumble and Lissandra were deleted because they don't have free gap closers.
Rumble and Liss ARE played in the LSC a lot... what are you trying to imply
You need to learn to understand sarcasm
Really? Oh... I don't know. I guess they weren't deleted then?

Basing how OP a champion is on the LCS is a very poor way of judging it. We're talking about the larger chunk of the player base, not the few esports pros.

A champion isn't broken because a certain amount of people do or don't play them. They're broken based on their stats/cost/etc.

**(Reposting due to bugged forums)**

> No, you shouldn't actively involve yourself in PvP based balance when all you play is PvE, the E being bots.

I said that I played on Garena for many years. I was here since Season 1. I only play bots on NA. Now please move on to something that actually addresses my arguments.

> Few things here. "Resourceless mobility by itself" doesn't exist in the game and won't. Champions kits are balanced as a kit or a whole, not singled out parts of them and then thrown together. Resourceless mobility combined with high damage output isn't a balanced kit.

Right back at you.

Now, please show me how resourceless mobility is broken by itself. Meaning, a Lee Sin that does low damage is broken, or how Riven is broken, or how Renekton is broken, or how a Kalista that has limit on Rend stack, and dashes being reduced by slow is broken, because you know, it's still resourceless mobility.

Edit: You might want to take a look at [this](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/JxpE1vrE-no-one-complained-about-zed-before-mana-regen-nerfs) if you want to argue that Zed is inherently problematic and broken.

1. I picked the points that were even slightly valid in any minor point. 
2. Your arguments are flawed because you don't pvp and are talking about pvp balance.
